intro: Nonea vivianii, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in a single head. Nonea vivianii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
